0.Pros: The crew were awesome, always met our targets
0.Cons: Customers are disrespectful and rude for no reason

1.Pros: Very flexible with schedules and there are ample opportunities for advancement. A few benefits are offered, McD's is a good company to work for if you are a student or in between jobs.
1.Cons: Fast-paced, you deal with lots of rude people on a daily basis. Unless you advance to management positions the salary is awful. Supervisors/managers can be rude sometimes.

2.Pros: Great work experience. Great crew members.
2.Cons: Not enough inspections. Could have more help on weekends when numbers are low.

3.Pros: Teaches you a lot of good work ethics. Can move up the ladder rather easily.
3.Cons: Never good enough, you always have to do better.

4.Pros: it was great to be there with people. some people are very positive in their attitudes toward cultures and politics
4.Cons: it was bad to be there with people. some people are very negative with their responses and cultures of persons.

5.Pros: My boss was really friendly to all of us. She was like a second mom to us. Our regular customers were generally really nice and were easy to get to know.
5.Cons: The customers can be rude but that is typical to fast food places. They generally dont allow piercings but my boss let us slide with having numerous ones.

6.Summary: "Is a well development job but the paid is to little"
6.Pros: Free meals, flexible hours, good enviroment
6.Cons: Is not well paid, costumers complaints are a litlle ofensive

7.Pros: free food, allowed drinks while working, meet a ton of new people
7.Cons: TIRED, constantly asking you to come in, full shifts, little flexibility

8.Pros: its alright for the type of work
8.Cons: angry customers will get you sometimes

9.Cons: Sometimes i wasnt able to finish my shift
